item.title: Ticket #6716 (Permalink slug not fully editable) updated
item.dc:creator: cyndin
item.description:
Replying to Viper007Bond:

An autosave is triggered when you deselect the title field. This autosave triggers a slug to be created.

Except I didn't deselect it one of the times...I was in the middle of typing.

As for the stats, are you talking about a plugin or something? If so, bug reports for plugins don't belong here. ;)

Blog stats is a plugin for 2.3 and earlier but I think it's been integrated into WP 2.5 (I may be wrong). Anyway, it's not a bug of the stats program. All it's doing is grabbing the slug line from somewhere it is stored. The issue is that it's stored wrong in at least one place.

item.description: I'm able to reproduce this with IE6 and IE7 using r7677.

item.title: Ticket #6728 (Publishing a new Page creates a Draft) created
item.dc:creator: elusivelight
item.description:
On a new install with no plugins activated:

I create a new Page, enter a title (no other info entered), and click on Publish. The "saving draft" text briefly appears before the page reloads. On the Manage Pages page, for every page, there is a Published Page and an Unpublished Page, both with the same name. This occurs for every Page I create. This is occuring on several different installs on the same server, using either Firefox or IE.

PHP Version 5.1.6 Linux 2.6.9-67.0.1.ELsmp #1 SMP Wed Dec 19 16:01:12 EST 2007 i686

Why wait for 2.6 and why take out a function that some consider essential? It works for people who had previous installs- you are causing major headaches for new users who want this functionality.

item.title: Ticket #6725 ($page_hook should not be translated in localized wordpress versions) created
item.dc:creator: whoismanu
item.description:
localized version of wordpress like e.g. the french one that can be obtained at â€‹http://fr.wordpress.org/ translate page hooks. to me this is bad practice because non localized plugins which use page hooks will no longer work with these localized versions of wordpress (even though they work perfectly fine with the english one).

example:

my plugin used the admin_print_scripts-page_hook hook like this: 

add_action('admin_print_scripts-manage_page_whoismanu-photoq', array(&$this,'addHeaderCode'), 1);

this works perfectly fine on the english wp. on the french version however the same page hook is translated to gerer_page_whoismanu-photoq and to work the hook in my plugin would have to be 

add_action('admin_print_scripts-gerer_page_whoismanu-photoq', array(&$this,'addHeaderCode'), 1);

this translation is done in fr_FR.po on lines 4642-4646: 

#: wp-admin/menu.php:17
#: wp-admin/menu.php:19
#: wp-admin/menu.php:21
msgid "Manage"
msgstr "GÃ©rer"

to see that this what happens, just install the french version of wp and 

echo "page hook: " . $page_hook;

in admin-header.php.

now, i cannot account for all possible translations in my plugin so i guess the page hooks should not be translated but be unique. otherwise the admin_print_scripts-page_hook function seems to be quite useless as already stated here: â€‹http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/4563 (this ticket was quite old and closed and seems to describe the same problem. so not sure whether it was never fixed or whether it just resurfaced. as it was closed and old, i.e., not recently opened and closed as the guidelines state, i didn't post there but made a new ticket. sorry if this wasn't the approach to take).

item.title: Ticket #6724 (Option for Draft-mode XML-RPC posts) updated
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description:
Cc changed

I'm not sure I see the point in this. You can already save drafts via XML-RPC, you don't have to set them to publish. If your blog client doesn't support doing this, talk the author about having it added. I'd be happy to work with them on any XML-RPC issues, and there's also the â€‹http://lists.automattic.com/mailman/listinfo/wp-xmlrpc email list.

If you goal is to not allow any of your users to publish directly from XML-RPC, then I suggest setting their role to Contributer. This way they won't be allowed to publish posts, but will be able to save them, for other users to review and publish.

item.title: Ticket #6724 (Option for Draft-mode XML-RPC posts) created
item.dc:creator: cnslcwby
item.description:
I'd like to see an option for making all posts that are created via XML-RPC be saved as drafts.

This way you could write the post in an external editor, but would still have the option do edit it before it's published in the WP editor (to upload images, or in the case of using Google Docs, add a title, etc.)

I've done this with my own install by editing xmlrpc.php, but if it was an option in the admin interface, it'd make upgrading easier.

item.title: Ticket #6723 (get_page_uri returns invalid URLs for multibyte page slug) created
item.dc:creator: lilyfan
item.description:
If a page has a multibyte page slug (like %E4%BE%8B ; means "example" in japanese), get_page_uri() returns invalid URL as "â€‹http://example.com/ä¾‹/". It is not compliant with RFC 1748, because a UTF-8 character is inlcuded in the path. The reason is that get_page_uri() does "urldecode($page->post_name)". Thus "%E4%BE%8B" is decoded to "ä¾‹" (a UTF-8 character).

The solution is to avoid using urldecode().

item.title: Ticket #6722 (wp_list_bookmarks() bug when filtering on category_name) created
item.dc:creator: drdavid
item.description:
When supplying the category_name argument to wp_list_bookmarks() in an attempt to only obtain the bookmarks in that category, this fails.

I have traced the error back to the following line (line 175 in wp_includes/bookmark-template.php in revision 7634):

$cats = get_terms('link_category', "category_name=$category_name&include=$category&orderby=$category_orderby&order=$category_order&hierarchical=0");

The argument to get_terms() is wrong, it should be name__like= instead of category_name=:

$cats = get_terms('link_category', "name__like=$category_name&include=$category&orderby=$category_orderby&order=$category_order&hierarchical=0");

Works for me.

item.title: Ticket #6612 (Problems with setting XML-RPC date using metWeblog.newPost()) closed
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description:
invalid:

It finally dawned on me what is probably happening here. Instead of sending dateCreated as a dateTime.iso8601, he was probably using the string type.

I've heard back from some of the other blog clients and they haven't had a problem using dateCreated, so I'm closing this as invalid. If further details come up that conclude there is indeed a problem we can always re-open this ticket.

item.title: Ticket #6721 (Shortcodes no longer work in WYSIWYG links) created
item.dc:creator: randyhoyt
item.description:
I have written a number of plugins that use shortcodes successfully in the WordPress 2.3 WYSIWYG editor. (For example, one of them allows the user to highlight a piece of text, click the "link" button, and type in [ISBN:0123456789]. WordPress will then convert that into a link to the Amazon page for the book with that ISBN. Another one allows for easy linking to other posts and pages in the site by typing in something like [PAGE:contact].)

These plugins no longer work. In WordPress 2.5, the WYSIWYG editor prepends the WordPress URL to these ... so now the WYSIWYG editor is saving â€‹http://domain.com/wp-admin/[ISBN:0123456789] instead of just the shortcode.

item.title: Ticket #6720 (Publishing a new page after editing an existing page confuses WordPress) created
item.dc:creator: jgbishop
item.description:
If a user edits an existing page (call it page A), then immediately creates and publishes a new page (call it page B), WordPress returns the user to page A, not page B.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Go to "Manage > Pages" and select an existing page to edit.
  2. Edit the selected page.
  3. Save your changes.
  4. From the saved page, go to the "Write > Page" screen.
  5. Create a new page.
  6. Publish the new page.
  7. Note that WordPress has returned to the page we edited in step 2, not the one we just created in step 5. In other words, WordPress didn't return to the appropriate place!

Expected results: WordPress should return to the page we were just editing, not one we edited a while ago.

Actual results: WordPress forgot where we were.

item.title: Ticket #6719 (Pressit function missing in WP 2.5) created
item.dc:creator: nextwave
item.description: After being a key part of the Wordpress experience for the last 3 years+ the WordPress Pressit bookmarklet function has disappeared from WP 2.5 Agreed, it shouldn't be at the bottom of every write page window- however, it should be in user options interface. Not having this in the base install is a pain for those of us who live by it- and have to use a workaround to make a bookmark. I'm thinking of authoring a plugin to restore this functionality- however, that seems like a bad move when "code is poetry"

item.title: Ticket #6716 (Permalink slug not fully editable) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Now, in WP 2.5, the slug seems to get created at a very early point in writing the post. My guess is when the first auto-save occurs after something is in the title, but I can't confirm that.

An autosave is triggered when you deselect the title field. This autosave triggers a slug to be created.

I too would wish the slug would auto-update to match the title until the post was actually saved (as opposed to autosaved). Too many times I've partially typed in the title, or changed the title, mid-writing.

As for the stats, are you talking about a plugin or something? If so, bug reports for plugins don't belong here. ;)

It's easier to just use the "alignnone" class to do those specific stylings rather than applying it to all images and then undoing it fro alignleft, right, etc.

item.title: Ticket #6702 (Raise in the Wordpress number of queries in nested pages) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
Keywords, Milestone changed

Replying to tiosolid:

On the other pages where the error occours the problematic function is the same (_get_post_ancestors)

To me it looks like theres a logic error:
â€‹http://trac.wordpress.org/browser/trunk/wp-includes/post.php#L2968 

	if ( !isset($_post->ancestors) )
		return;

While that seems to say do not load ancestors if none are allready set to me, However, I'm not sure if thats quite correct in general.

Eitherway, The attached patch prevents those multiple queries for me, It limits it to finding the ancestors once per page request, I thought of wrapping it in a wp_cache_get/set however, this seems to do the job.

item.title: Ticket #6718 (Theme defined in a constant at the beginning of the script) created
item.dc:creator: kazdam
item.description:
In every version of wordpress, the theme path is defined in a constant, which is defined at the all beginning of the script.

This is disallowing plugins developers to modify the theme used in an extension if some others datas are requires (like the post id) are required to get the current theme.

It might be a good idea to define it later, at least after defining the $post var.

item.description: In wp-admin.cssâ€‹ the background-color property of the #tTips selector is set to thansparent. It should probably be transparent.

item.title: Ticket #6680 (Full post RSS feeds can not break at the <!--more--> point) updated
item.dc:creator: hexley
item.description:
Fine, PI is ok with me. What is wrong, IMHO, is that a change was made, to behavior some people come to rely on, and that was not made clear in upgrade notes or as far as I can tell, in any documentation at all.

I spent 3 hours or so in the code, trying to trace these nested functions here and there, to suspect it was a bug, but it turns out to be an intentional change.

item.title: Ticket #6556 (Impossible to move text/rss widgets between sidebars) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Replying to codeispoetry:

(Code should be poetry, but there is no reason to sacrifice intuitive user interfaces for that.)

Which is why I'm fully for allowing easy moving of widgets from one sidebar to another.

I was merely saying that this new widget manager is a huge step forward, albeit an imperfect one, and we shouldn't give up on it so easily and go back to the old multiple instances of widgets on the left hand side (which was rather crude).

item.title: Ticket #6716 (Permalink slug not fully editable) created
item.dc:creator: cyndin
item.description:
In older versions of WP, a slug for the permalink was created from the title at the point you published it. So "My Day Today" would turn into "my-day-today."

Now, in WP 2.5, the slug seems to get created at a very early point in writing the post. My guess is when the first auto-save occurs after something is in the title, but I can't confirm that. You can edit the slug at any point, but it does not change in all locations.

For one post, the first slug that WP created was from the title I put in. A few minutes into writing the post, I decided to change the title. The slug did not change with it. I edited the slug to reflect the new title.

For another post, the slug that WP created was the first four letters of the first word of the title. In other words, it grabbed a slug while I was in the middle of typing. I then edited the slug.

In both cases, the correct slug was displayed on the permalink on the main page of the blog, on the sidebar for the lists of posts, and in some other places on the blog itself.

However, when I view blog stats, the original (incorrect) slug shows up as the title of the post. The link is not a permalink (it's the question mark and number), though it turns into the (correct) permalink when I click on it.

It's a minor inconvience if it is limited to blog stats (though it makes it harder to remember which post it is referring to...one "title" is simply "surv" for example).

My concern is that it may occur elsewhere. I haven't found it anywhere else yet, but I wanted to report this bug right away.

item.title: Ticket #6556 (Impossible to move text/rss widgets between sidebars) updated
item.dc:creator: codeispoetry
item.description:
it's 100x better IMO, especially from a coder's standpoint.

I think it is not an exaggeration to say that one of the reasons of the immense success of WordPress has been exactly that its UI didn't generally reflect the coder's standpoint, but rather that of the user. (Code should be poetry, but there is no reason to sacrifice intuitive user interfaces for that.)

item.title: Ticket #6715 (Hitting publish button got error then going to HTML mode made post ...) created
item.dc:creator: cyndin
item.description:
I wrote a new post (over several minutes, so the auto-save did its thing). I hit the publish button and got that popup that I get when trying to close a "write post" window about nagivating away from the page. (see â€‹http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/6711 )

Of course I hit cancel. Then I was back in the post. Somehow, I got the idea to cut and paste all my text over to a word file, just in case. Then I decided to peek at the HTML code for the post.

The post disappeared! The HTML window came up but the text area was blank. The title and slug are intact, along with my tags and categories. But the text is gone. I went back to visual mode and the text is still missing.

I have checked my blog and the post did not publish. The post is listed as a draft, but the text is still missing (it's no longer blank though...the only thing there is a close-linebreak marker.

Trying this again...I pasted the text back into the draft. I fixed a couple of formatting things that were lost (took several tries; it messed with my code as a tried). I went into HTML mode; text was still there. Went back to Visual mode; text was still there.

I tried "publish" again and this time it worked.

What a terrifying bug! I've never lost a post before. In fact, the older versions of WP were so good that if my browser or computer crashed while I was in the middle of a post, even if I never hit "save," there would be a draft waiting for me with everything but the last couple of seconds.

item.title: Ticket #6714 (incorrect grammer in the en_us home page for translate.wordpress.com) closed
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
invalid:

This site is for support tickets having to do with WordPress the open-source application, not WordPress.com, which is a business site of Automattic, Inc. You can bring up WordPress.com support issues â€‹here. (You also might want to change "who are interesting" to "who are interested," and "grammer" to "grammar.")

item.title: Ticket #6714 (incorrect grammer in the en_us home page for translate.wordpress.com) created
item.dc:creator: triplelinde
item.description:
totally forgivable mistake but probably contrary to the goal/mission of proper localization of wordpress:

This is a project where people who are speak English and another language can make WordPress.com available in their language of choice for themselves and their country.

perhaps, instead: "This is a project for people who speak English as well as another language and who are interesting in making WordPress.com accessible for their fellow language-speakers and/or countrymen."

item.title: Ticket #5998 (Invalid Unicode characters) updated
item.dc:creator: bertilow
item.description:
I think a case can be made for this not being WordPress's job at all. The checking should be done in MySQL. If the database has been correctly set to UTF-8, no invalid characters should ever be stored in the database in the first place. If they're not stored, then they will not show up or do damage.

It would still be wise the check for them though, just in case. But perhaps this bug should be forwarded to MySQL.

item.title: Ticket #6613 (Uploader: return an ID not HTML from async-upload) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description: Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #6635 (Move categories & tags back to the Write Post/Page sidebar for ...) updated
item.dc:creator: cyndin
item.description:
Thanks, jabecker. But I haven't the faintest idea what to do with those files. I know how to edit themes, as I can get right into the code from the dashboard. But I can't alter WP code from there. I could do it from emacs on my unix shell where WP is installed, but the files are all in a particular format with line numbers. I can't cut and paste that.

I suppose I am meant to download the files to my computer and then upload them to the WP directory (not sure where they go exactly). But do I need to upload all of them? Do they work together or are they separate? Do I edit the old files or just outright replace them? And won't this mean I can't upgrade WP again? My ISP's upgrader barfs if I so much as download the latest version of a plugin...even if I get it to work, will I lose all my changes and have to do it again in a week or two when 2.5.1 comes out?

I'm not a coder or a developer. I'm pretty knowledgable about computers and web design but have never worked with php and css before (they are newer than when I learned this stuff).

I appreciate that you have taken the time to write and upload these changes, but I don't know where to go from here.

See #6713.

item.title: plan-b-r7641-2.patch attached to Ticket #6713
item.dc:creator: tellyworth

item.title: Ticket #6713 (swfupload: server response is truncated in some Flash versions) created
item.dc:creator: tellyworth
item.description:
There is a bug in either swfupload or Flash itself that sometimes causes the server response from a file upload to be truncated in Linux and Mac OS:

â€‹http://code.google.com/p/swfupload/issues/detail?id=4&colspec=ID%20Type%20Status%20Summary%20FixReleasedIn%20FixTargetedFor

It appears only to happen on certain servers. I've been able to reproduce this using my MacBook - it fails on some WP installs but not others. I haven't been able to determine the cause (nor have the swfupload developers it appears) but I suspect it's a bug in the Flash Player's TCP/IP code.

The enclosed patch works around the problem by greatly reducing the size of the server response to a Flash file upload. Instead of returning a big chunk o html on success it returns the ID of the uploaded file. The html detail form for the file is then fetched in a second ajax request.

item.title: Ticket #6661 (IE6 overlap renders uploader media library unusable) updated
item.dc:creator: tellyworth
item.description:
The new patch works well in IE6, Safari 3.1 and Firefox 2. The overlap issue in IE6 is fixed. Progress bars display in all three browsers. I haven't yet tested Opera.

There are some visual differences with 2.5.0 but I think they are acceptable. The clickmask is gone (but as noted above, I don't think that's a major issue - it caused some compatibility issues and didn't work on the Gallery or Choose File tabs). The markup and CSS is slightly simpler, and the duplicate progress divs have been removed If anyone can improve on it, please do.

item.title: media-library-ie6-overlap-r7641-2.patch attached to Ticket #6661
item.dc:creator: tellyworth
item.description: Fix the progress bar, remove some unnecessary markup

item.title: Ticket #1258 (Curly quotes mixups) updated
item.dc:creator: mtekk
item.description: I'm not proficient in regular expressions, but it looks like the function causing the problem is wptexturize(). There should be a simpler way of implementing the rules than what is there now, especially the arrays on lines 23 & 24. Anyways, anyone that is familiar with regular expressions can take a look at those two lines and it should be easy for them to fix.

item.title: Ticket #6711 (Closing "write post" window in 2.5 leads to popup asking if you want ...) created
item.dc:creator: cyndin
item.description:
I found related tickets but nothing for 2.5 directly on point.

If I try to close the "write post" window, I get a popup asking:

"Are you sure you want to navigate away from this page? The changes you made will be lost if you navigate away from this page. Press okay to continue or cancel to stay on the current page."

This did not occur in WP 2.3. I use Mozilla on OS 10.2.8 on a Mac G4.

I got this error repeatedly even though I had not changed the page since last doing a manual save. It had been idle for hours. I am guessing that the auto-save reset it to be marked as edited.

As a test, I did another manual save and closed the window. It closed promptly without the popup warning.

This sounds like a useful feature that merely needs some tweaking to avoid false positives.

Thanks.

item.title: Ticket #1258 (Curly quotes mixups) updated
item.dc:creator: mtekk
item.description: Problem confirmed in latest SVN, it looks like it defaults to the ending curl, and for some reason has an additional rule to make sure that before an s does that too, when what it really should do is default as it does now, but if the preceding character is a space it should change to the beginning curl.

item.title: Ticket #6539 (404 page does not appear when using static home page) updated
item.dc:creator: tenpura
item.description:
The patch typecasts $reqpage to integer temporarily only when 404. This way it won't break setting posts page.

The patch typecasts $reqpage to string.

item.title: Ticket #6539 (404 page does not appear when using static home page) updated
item.dc:creator: tenpura
item.description: The patch typecasts $reqpage to integer temporarily only when 404. This way it won't break setting posts page.

item.title: Ticket #6710 (Alignment classes from image insert) created
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
The align classes we insert from the image uploader seem to have no impact in the WYSIWYG or default theme. Lame.

Secondly, there is no reason to have an "alignnone" class, if there's no alignment, just don't put a class.

item.title: Ticket #6702 (Raise in the Wordpress number of queries in nested pages) updated
item.dc:creator: tiosolid
item.description:
Thanks for the plugin. According to the plugin's dump (I took out the "normal" queries and started the dump from the strange ones): 

    [20] => Array
        (
            [0] => SELECT t.*, tt.* FROM wp_terms AS t INNER JOIN wp_term_taxonomy AS tt ON t.term_id = tt.term_id WHERE tt.taxonomy IN ('category')  AND ( t.term_id <> 58 ) ORDER BY t.name ASC
            [1] => 9.10758972168E-05
            [2] => get_terms
        )
    [21] => Array
        (
            [0] => SELECT `post_parent` FROM wp_posts WHERE ID= '286' LIMIT 1
            [1] => 7.89165496826E-05
            [2] => _get_post_ancestors
        )
    [22] => Array
        (

item.title: Ticket #6709 (Usability changes to write post and write page panels) created
item.dc:creator: jabecker
item.description:
I've attached modified .php files that address three major usability issues with the version 2.5 write post / write page panels.

1) Too much scrolling is required. Items that were in the sidebar in 2.3 should be moved back.

2) Display a list of draft posts in the title as in 2.3.

3) Remove the maximum width so that users with wide screens are not forced to a narrow writing area.

item.title: Ticket #6706 (Opera 9.10 TinyMCE buttons display on first hover only) closed
item.dc:creator: azaozz
item.description:
invalid:

Seems to be known issue with old versions of the browser. Usually doesn't happen after the page has been loaded once and the images are in the browser's cache. Updating Opera to the current stable version 9.27 will help.

item.title: Ticket #6705 (TinyMCE cursor jumps on delete key in FF3b5 Windows) closed
item.dc:creator: azaozz
item.description: invalid

item.title: Ticket #6705 (TinyMCE cursor jumps on delete key in FF3b5 Windows) updated
item.dc:creator: azaozz
item.description:
Milestone changed

There are several minor issues with Firefox 3-beta. They come and go with the different beta builds and will be resolved once the stable version of the browser is released. Until then, for best results try using the stable Firefox 2.x.

item.title: Ticket #6544 (TinyMCE HTTPS handling) reopened
item.dc:creator: craigandrews
item.description:
Yes - please backport to 2.5.1. My company requires the use of HTTPS for sites requiring login, so this a maintenance hassle for me as the admin :-/

(not sure if I'm breaking protocol by changing the milestone and re-opening - if so, my apologies!)

Thanks!

item.title: Ticket #6708 (Regression in Widgets editing) created
item.dc:creator: ylevy
item.description:
Not sure if you want to consider this a defect or an enhancement request, I am missing a feature of the old Widgets editor where I could drag and drop widgets from one side bar to the other.

I have not found any other way to do this with the current version at wordpress.com, other than

  • edit the widgets to copy out its content
  • remove the widget
  • select the second sidebar in the drop down menu
  • add the widget again
  • copy the content into it again

either the problem is between the chair and the keyboard and you'll teach me how to do this efficiently, or the new user interface is less efficient than the old one.

I'm also missing a few features of the old interface including

  • the word counter
  • the post author section
  • the media library / gallery *large* thumbnail view. I understand it is less useful for other media than pictures, but the current list is IMO a regression. I choose images by their look, not by their title, and the current list view does ont do it for me: too small thumbnails, lots of wasted space for a description I don't need. How about making the description appear on hoovering (and getting back the larger size thumbnail)?

best regards Yuv

item.title: Ticket #6707 (Your attempt to edit this post: "title" has failed.) created
item.dc:creator: lloydbudd
item.description:
Your attempt to edit this post: "title" has failed
is the result after trying to Save a trivial post of title + paste some text into the post body. The title is saved, but not the body of the post.

I often do this to save a quote or URL for authoring a post later. If nothing else, having this simple test scenario work is essential for people to have confidence in WP.

ENV: Trunk / r7641 (2.6-bleeding)
Firefox/3.0b5

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

My guess is that it's a timing issue related to the trigger of the first autosave.

The please try again link is to 'wp-admin/post-new.php' which also doesn't inspire confidence.

I searched and there are a number of discussions on the forums with this error message. â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/165717 includes the most insights and seems to suggest that there may be 3 possible issues here: conflict with plugins, byte order mark, or conflict with autosave.

item.title: Ticket #6706 (Opera 9.10 TinyMCE buttons display on first hover only) created
item.dc:creator: ylevy
item.description:
This is my second bug reports - discovered it while filing the first one ;-)

Starting the TinyMCE on Opera 9.10, only the Bold button is visible - all other buttons are empty until I hover over them. Using wordpress.com.

Best regards Yuv

item.title: Ticket #6705 (TinyMCE cursor jumps on delete key in FF3b5 Windows) created
item.dc:creator: ylevy
item.description:
This is my first bug report - please forgive me if I make mistakes and point me to the right direction.

I've searched trac.wordpress.org for a similar report and did not find it, so I assume this won't be a duplicate.

Bug encountered on â€‹http://panospace.wordpress.com/ (thank you all for this wonderful infrastructure!).

  • Edit a post.
  • Insert two empty paragraphs somwhere in the middle.
  • Point the cursor at the beginning of the first empty paragraph.
  • Press the DEL key. As expected it will go away.
  • Press the DEL key again.
  • BUG! The cursor moved at the beginning of the post and deleted the first character there.

Bug does not happen in Opera 9.10.

Yuv

item.title: Ticket #5809 (Updating a term in one taxonomy affects the term in every taxonomy) updated
item.dc:creator: asmodai
item.description: The problem is that wp_term_taxonomy refers to wp_terms for the name of the category/tag for both category and tag. One could argue that tagging a post filed in a category with the same name as the tag is redundant. klawd's restructuring makes sense to me though, proper separation might be better overall.

item.title: Ticket #5809 (Updating a term in one taxonomy affects the term in every taxonomy) updated
item.dc:creator: asmodai
item.description:
Version changed

I can verify that this is a problem in the released 2.5.

item.title: Ticket #6635 (Move categories & tags back to the Write Post/Page sidebar for ...) updated
item.dc:creator: cyndin
item.description: Some of the changes to this page are excellent (love that WP remembers which areas you open and change and which ones you leave shut and on the default) but I agree that catagories should be back to the sidebar. I don't actually mind the scrolling, but when it was on the sidebar it had more space. Now I only have 6 lines showing in the box, which is a pain when you have dozens of categories.

item.title: Ticket #6704 (Spellchecker in WP 2.5 crashes browser) created
item.dc:creator: cyndin
item.description:
Running Mozilla on a Mac G4 with OS 10.2.8. Can't run Firefox or other browsers on 10.2 and unable to upgrade to 10.4 quite yet.

There were substantial spellchecker bugs in the older Wordpress (see â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/154864 ) but it did work. Now, simply clicking on the speckchecker button causes the browser to crash. This happened twice.

Thanks.

item.title: Ticket #6703 (Insert into post fails: The media window is cleared in Firefox) updated
item.dc:creator: tellyworth
item.description: I've seen this happen with frameset domain forwarders. Does the domain of the URL in your browser's nav bar when you're on the Write Post page match the one in your WordPress address (Settings/general)?

item.title: Ticket #6703 (Insert into post fails: The media window is cleared in Firefox) created
item.dc:creator: bazil749
item.description:
I have no idea why this is happening, however it only happens on an upgrade. I've updated 3 blogs and this problem happens on 2 out of the three. I have disabled ALL plugins, replace all the files again (just in case some corruption happened), but nothing works. Using Firebug, this is error I caught in the console:

uncaught exception: Permission denied to get property Window.send_to_editor Line 0

IE 7 doesn't even get that far. There's a Javascript error in the call to media-upload.php line 136 when the media window is just opened. I can't insert any media.

item.title: Ticket #6686 (New Feature: insert header & footer snippets) updated
item.dc:creator: Mrasnika
item.description:
Replying to westi:

The wp_head and wp_footer hooks already make it simple to write a plugin to contain your theme-independent customisations.

Storing these customisations in the database just seems like a waste.

The point of this feature is to make it easier for the non-programmers to deal with persistent, theme-independent header/footer HTML snippets. Anyway, thanks for the comments

item.title: Changeset [7641]: Direct file system manip fixes, should fix .svn upgrade problem. Hat ...
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: Direct file system manip fixes, should fix .svn upgrade problem. Hat tip: DD32.

item.title: Ticket #6686 (New Feature: insert header & footer snippets) updated
item.dc:creator: strider72
item.description:
Replying to westi:

The wp_head and wp_footer hooks already make it simple to write a plugin to contain your theme-independent customisations.

Storing these customisations in the database just seems like a waste.

With respect, I think that sort of misses the point. This is meant for the non-programmer.

However, as it readily works as a plugin, there is no burning need for it to be in core. That is, nothing is lost by not having it "always available".

So... I guess I agree with your conclusion (not needed in core), but not your reasoning.

Actually, there is an advantage to this not being "always available" as part of core: lazy plugin authors would probably use it, even though it _isn't_ meant for them. So in that sense there is a specific advantage to leaving this as a plugin, that is actually _lost_ by making it core.

Great plugin, though. I'll probably use it myself!

item.title: Ticket #6701 (XmlRpc responses truncated due to UTF-8 BOM) updated
item.dc:creator: azaozz
item.description:
You've mentioned Live Writer, could that be something added by it when importing UTF-8 feeds? Most Windows text editors add BOM to UTF-8 files, including Notepad...

In any case it's better to strip the BOM than to increase the Content-Length header. Something like this would work: 

$xml = preg_replace("/^\x{feff}/u", "", $xml);
